column4: When I start a new application on my Ubuntu box, it does not appear in the taskbar (is it the gnome-panel?) on the screen. How can I fix it?
This started happening yesterday after a rogue application crashed my gnome-panel
which gnome version?
It's gnome panel version 2.14. And mwe thanks for the ~/.gnome suggestion. I'll try it out.
check your libwnck version, "dpkg -s libwnck"
check your libwnck version, " sudo dpkg -s libwnck "
:Package `libwnck' is not installed and no info is available.
sorry, my fault, it's libwnck-common
it is: 2.14.0-0ubuntu1
that's why, the wnck-applets bug is only fixed in libwnck-2.14.1
it was working till yesterday until a bad application crashed the gnome-panel. Do you think it'll work if I delete ~/.gnome*?
it will reset your gnome user settings, but gnome will crash again, so, upgrade gnome to 2.14.1 ( in dapper)
but this has worked well for ages and only started crashing yesterday.
it's a known gnome bug
the gnome bug tracking, http://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=316096
quit gnome, in console or another wm/de, "rm -rf ~/.gnome*"
yes this time after "gdm stop", I "rm -rf"d all .gnome dirs
and?
and restarted gdm, but still see the same problem when I logged in.
you rmed the correct location?
mwe, it worked when I deleted .gconf this time. thanks for your help!
